EmailTemplate.subject: Shell Fuel Card Program - Additional Information Required
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you for your interest in our Shell Fuel Card Program!
To enroll in an account with us, please send in a deposit to secure the account along with the attached Deposit form. You may either mail the deposit to our bank or wire us the funds.
Sending the deposit form by mail, email or fax:
- Complete and sign the attached deposit agreement (the minimum deposit is $500) - Send the form to our bank (address below) with a certified check, money order or cashier’s check for the amount you would like to put on deposit - Reference opportunity # (insert number here) and mention the check is for a secured deposit in the memo section of the check - Either scan/email or fax a copy of the completed and signed deposit agreement to me at the email noted below or {!User.Fax}
Bank Address: WEX Canada Ltd. 7090 Union Park Center, Suite 350 Midvale, UT 84047 USA
When the deposit is received, your account will be set up and the deposit applied will become your line of credit.
To comply with the Patriot Act, our bank needs you to verify your physical address for approval. Please provide documentation from a third party to verify your business is located at the correct address listed on your application.
To pass verification, the bank requires a copy of one of the following documents: - Utility bill or insurance document showing that the bill is mailed to the physical street address or that it services the physical address of the business - Lease agreement which identifies the business and the physical address of the office - Certified articles of incorporation - An unexpired government-issued business license
Feel free to scan and email the verification to me at the email noted below, or if you prefer, you can fax it to me at {!User.Fax}. You can also call me at {!User.Phone} if you have any questions.
Sincerely,
{!User.FirstName} {!User.LastName} {!User.Title} Phone - {!User.Phone} Fax - {!User.Fax} {!User.Email}
